intro: Chresta harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's chresta, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
